creator: jlf27@buffalo.edu
text:
hello and good day--i'm wanting to send the '-quiet' tag into javadoc but ant 
does not seem to have updated this with the newer versions of javadoc.  please 
add support for this.  *whispers quietly, 'thanks'*

-jlf

creator: jlf27@buffalo.edu
text:
hrm--i could not verify that ant now takes advantage of all the new tags in 
javadoc, here is a link for all supported options which are new:

http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/tooldocs/javadoc/whatsnew-1.4.html

thank you muchly!  sorry for any redundancy.
-jlf

"Use nested <arg> to specify additional arguments. See Command line arguments. 
Since Ant 1.6"

From the manual. --DD
creator: ddevienne@lgc.com

text:
I don't thionk we'd be able to keep up with all new options all the time 8-)

We usually add the features that users ask for, and we've done so for taglets,
linksource and breakiterator for example.

<javadoc> supports the additionalparam attribute for cases where the task couldn't
keep up with the changes.
creator: bodewig@apache.org

text: I think additionalparams is suffocient here.
creator: bodewig@apache.org
